definition[0]: a type of popular music in which the words of a song are not sung, but spoken in time to music with a steady beat
definition[1]: a series of quick sharp hits or knocks
example[1]: She was woken by a sharp rap on the door.
definition[2]: a statement by the police saying that someone is responsible for a serious crime
example[2]: The kid’s been cited twice on drunk-driving raps.
definition[3]: to hit or knock something quickly several times
example[3]: She rapped the table with her pen.
example[4]: Angrily she rapped on his window.
definition[4]: to say the words of a rap song
definition[5]: to criticize someone angrily – used especially in news reports
example[5]: a film rapped by critics for its excessive violence
definition[6]: to say something loudly, suddenly, and in a way that sounds angry
